articles.content:
Joint History Textbook Published 
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Historians, teachers and civic activists of south Korea, China and Japan published joint Northeast Asia history textbook "History Opening the Future", according to the south Korean CBS.
 The publication of the textbook is aimed at dealing from an objective point of view with the modern and contemporary history of Northeast Asia that suffered from aggression and war in order to provide a framework for reflecting on the past history and imbue the younger generation with historic views on peace, human rights and democracy, said CBS.

articles.title: Projected Building of Naval Base on Jeju Island Opposed
U.S. Reckless Plan for New Nuclear War Commanding System under Fire
articles.content:
Projected Building of Naval Base on Jeju Island Opposed 
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Hye Gyong, representative of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea, at a press conference held on May 26 voiced her opposition to the building of a naval base at Hwasun Port on Jeju Island, according to the south Korean CBS.
 In case a naval base is built there, the island can not but be reduced to a U.S. outpost for carrying out its new military strategy, she said.    
 This plan is quite contrary to the people's desire to make the island a tranquil one, she noted, demanding the total cancellation of the plan.

articles.content:
Immediate Release of Arrested Unionists Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Sun, member of the south Korean National Assembly from the Democratic Workers' Party, held a press conference at the NA building on May 24 to demand the immediate release of the 700 odd members of the Ulsan Construction Workers' Union who had been arrested while staging a legal demonstration for the guarantee of their right to existence, according to the south Korean MBC.
 Noting that they demanded the most elementary right as human beings, not an unreasonable wage hike, the lawmaker held that the chief of the police office deserved to be punished for resorting to violence against the demonstrators.    
 The employers and the Ministry of Labor are primarily to blame for this crisis as they paid no heed to the demand of the workers, the speaker added.

Lao Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Lao Party Delegation Arrives
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Somsavath Lengsavath, member and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of its Central Committee and deputy prime minister and concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs of the Lao government, arrived here Saturday.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chanpheng Sihaphom and staff members of the Lao embassy here.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Here
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Arrives
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos headed by Minister Thongbanh Seng A Phone arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by Kang Yong Ho, vice-minister of People's Security of the DPRK, and a councilor of the Lao Embassy here.
 The Ministry of People's Security hosted a reception for the delegation in the evening.

articles.title: Lao FM Pays Courtesy Call on DPRK FM
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Here
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Wajedul Islam Khan, general secretary of the Bangladesh Trade Unions' Centre, arrived here today.
 Also arriving were Managing Director Ali Mchumo of the Common Fund for Commodities and his party and a visiting group of Chinese ophthalmic experts led by Ren Yuanchu, chairman of the Shanghai Ophthalmology Association.

articles.title: Greetings to Ethiopian President
articles.content:
Lao FM Pays Courtesy Call on DPRK FM
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Somsavath Lengsavath, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of the government of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, today paid a courtesy call on Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DRPK.
 On hand were officials concerned, members of the delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the Lao ambassador to the DPRK.    
 The talk proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Working Contact Made
articles.content:
Greetings to Ethiopian President
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Girma Woldegiorgis, president of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, on Saturday on the occasion of the 14th anniversary of its national day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to boost as ever, the message wished the Ethiopian president and people greater success in their work for the country's stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Guinean President Leaves
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Working Contact Made
    Kaesong, May 28 (KCNA) -- A working contact took place in Kaesong from May 24 to 28 to send delegations of the authorities of the north and the south to the grand festival for national reunification to be held in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration.
 At the contact both sides reached a consensus on the issue of sending each a 70-member delegation of the authorities to the festival with a view to significantly decorating the festival as a nationwide grand one in the basic spirit of the joint declaration and agreed on a series of technical procedural issues related to this arrangement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Guinean President Leaves
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Facine Toure, special envoy of the Guinean president, and his party left here for home today.
 They were seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and officials concerned.
 During their stay they visited the old home in Mangyongdae where President Kim Il Sung was born, the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition, the Monument to Party Founding and the Three-Revolution Exhibition.    
 They also visited the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Pyongyang Metro and "Pueblo", the armed spy ship of the U.S. imperialists, and enjoyed an art performance given by members of the art group of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace at its theatre.
